com.firebase.jobdispatcher

Interface JobParameters

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Job, Job.Builder

    public interface JobParameters
    JobParameters represents anything that can describe itself in terms of Job components.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] getConstraints()
      The runtime constraints applied to this Job.
      Bundle getExtras()
      The optional set of user-supplied extras associated with this Job.
      int getLifetime()
      The Job's lifetime; how long it should persist for.
      RetryStrategy getRetryStrategy()
      The RetryStrategy for the Job.
      java.lang.String getService()
      Returns the name of the backing JobService class.
      java.lang.String getTag()
      Returns a string identifier for the Job.
      JobTrigger getTrigger()
      The Job's Trigger, which decides when the Job is ready to run.
      TriggerReason getTriggerReason() 
      boolean isRecurring()
      Whether the Job should repeat.
      boolean shouldReplaceCurrent()
      Whether the Job should replace a pre-existing Job with the same tag.

    • Method Detail

      • getService

        java.lang.String getService()
        Returns the name of the backing JobService class.

      • getTag

        java.lang.String getTag()
        Returns a string identifier for the Job. Used when cancelling Jobs and displaying debug messages.

      • getTrigger

        JobTrigger getTrigger()
        The Job's Trigger, which decides when the Job is ready to run.

      • getLifetime

        int getLifetime()
        The Job's lifetime; how long it should persist for.

      • isRecurring

        boolean isRecurring()
        Whether the Job should repeat.

      • getConstraints

        int[] getConstraints()
        The runtime constraints applied to this Job. A Job is not run until the trigger is activated and all the runtime constraints are satisfied.

      • getExtras

        Bundle getExtras()
        The optional set of user-supplied extras associated with this Job.

      • getRetryStrategy

        RetryStrategy getRetryStrategy()
        The RetryStrategy for the Job. Used to determine how to handle failures.

      • shouldReplaceCurrent

        boolean shouldReplaceCurrent()
        Whether the Job should replace a pre-existing Job with the same tag.

      • getTriggerReason

        TriggerReason getTriggerReason()
        Returns:
        A TriggerReason that - if non null - describes why the job was triggered.
